form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Peters (for himself and Mrs. Blackburn) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To exempt the Secretary of Energy of certain prohibitions with respect to an unmanned aircraft system, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Nuclear Ecosystem Drone Defense Act of 2025 or the NEDD Act of 2025.

section.header: Authority of Secretary of Energy with respect to covered unmanned aircraft systems from covered foreign entities

subsection.header: Exemption from prohibition on procurement of covered unmanned aircraft systems from covered foreign entities
subsection.text: Section 1823(b) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 (Public Law 118–31; 137 Stat. 692) is amended, in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by inserting Secretary of Energy, after Secretary of State,.

subsection.header: Exemption from prohibition on operation of covered unmanned aircraft systems from covered foreign entities
subsection.text: Section 1824(b) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 (Public Law 118–31; 137 Stat. 693) is amended, in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by inserting Secretary of Energy, after Secretary of State,.

subsection.header: Exemption from prohibition on use of Federal funds for procurement and operation of covered unmanned aircraft systems from covered foreign entities
subsection.text: Section 1825(b) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 (Public Law 118–31; 137 Stat. 694) is amended, in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by inserting Secretary of Energy, after Secretary of State,.

subsection.header: Granting Secretary of Energy authority To determine usage of classified tracking
subsection.text: Section 1827(b) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 (Public Law 118–31; 137 Stat. 696) is amended by striking the Secretary’s designee and inserting the Secretary of Energy, as appropriate, or their respective designees.

subsection.header: Granting Secretary of Energy accounting exception
subsection.text: Section 1827(c) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 (Public Law 118–31; 137 Stat. 696) is amended by inserting the Department of Energy, after the Department of Transportation,.

subsection.header: Expansion of Secretary of Energy authority related to the protection of certain nuclear facilities and assets from unmanned aircrafts or unmanned aircraft systems
subsection.text: Section 4510(e)(1)(C) of the Atomic Energy Defense Act (50 U.S.C. 2661(e)(1)(C)) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: owned by the United States or contracted to the United States—

clause.text: to store, transport, or use special nuclear material; or
